privacy-policy.small-description-3:
This page informs you of our policies regarding the collection,
use, and disclosure of personal information we receive from users
of the website.
privacy-policy.1-1:
We collect information using OAuth 2.0 authentication with GitHub.
When you log in or sign up via GitHub, we access certain
information associated with your GitHub account, such as:
privacy-policy.1-2:
• Personal Information: Your GitHub username, email
address, and profile picture (if provided).
privacy-policy.1-3:
• Public Information: Any public repositories or
projects linked to your GitHub account.
privacy-policy.1-4:
This information is used to create and manage your account, and
personalize your experience on our platform. Additionally, we use
Vercel Analytics to collect performance and user interaction data.
This includes but is not limited to page views, session duration,
and user interactions to help improve our platform’s performance
and user experience.
privacy-policy.2-1:
Cookies are files containing a small amount of data, which may
include an anonymous unique identifier. Cookies are sent to your
browser from a website and stored on your computer’s hard drive.
You can configure your browser to refuse all cookies or to
indicate when a cookie is sent. This site only uses cookies
necessary for its proper functioning. These cookies are not used
for tracking purposes. You are required to accept these cookies to
use our site.
privacy-policy.3-1:
The security of your personal information is important to us.
Development time has been dedicated to ensuring maximum security
for all our users through the use of secure services. Please keep
in mind that no method of transmission over the Internet or method
of electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to use
commercially acceptable means to protect your personal
information, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.
privacy-policy.4-1:
This privacy policy is effective as of the date above and will
remain in effect. Any modifications to its provisions will be
immediately applied after being published on this page. We reserve
the right to update or change our privacy policy at any time, and
you should periodically review this policy. Your continued use of
the service after we have posted changes to the privacy policy on
this page will constitute your acceptance of those changes and
your consent to abide by and be bound by the updated privacy
policy.

support.title: Frequently asked questions
support.description-1: These are the most commonly asked questions about Tournament-Pool.
support.description-2: Can't find what you're looking for ?

Q1.title: What is Tournament-Pool ?
Q1.response: This Tournament-Pool is a tournament management platform designed to streamline the creation and management of tournaments. It enables users to create tournaments, link teams, and add points to their respective teams. Additionally, the platform automatically generates charts based on the data, providing a dynamic and visual representation of team standings and performance throughout the tournament.

Q2.title: What are the main features of the platform?
Q2.response-1: • Tournament Creation: Easily set up tournaments with linked teams.
Q2.response-2: • Point Management: Assign and update points for teams.
Q2.response-3: • Chart Generation: Automatically display team standings and performance with dynamic charts.

Q3.title: How do I log in to Tournament-Pool?
Q3.response-1: Logging in is simple and secure with GitHub's two-factor authentication:
Q3.response-2: 1. Click on the 'Login with GitHub' button on the loginpage.
Q3.response-3: 2. Enter your GitHub credentials if prompted.
Q3.response-4: 3. Complete the two-factor authentication process by entering the code sent to your authenticator app or email.
Q3.response-5: 4. Once authenticated, you’ll be redirected to the platform's dashboard.

Q4.title: How do I create a tournament?
Q4.response-1: Creating a tournament is quick and intuitive:
Q4.response-2: 1. Navigate to the 'Create Tournament' section in your dashboard.
Q4.response-4: - Title: Enter the name of the tournament.
Q4.response-5: - Number of Teams: Select between 2 and 5 teams.
Q4.response-6: - Team Names and Colors: Assign a unique name and color to each team for easy identification.
Q4.response-8: 4. Your tournament is now set up, and you can start managing points or viewing standings.

Q5.title: What is the purpose of the /show/ID page?
Q5.response: The /show/ID page is a public, read-only view of the tournament. It automatically displays team standings and points based on the latest data. Users can see the results and performance charts without any interaction or manual updates.

Q6.title: What is the purpose of the /user/tournament/ID page?
Q6.response: The /user/tournament/ID page is for managing the tournament. Authorized users can update details, add points, and make changes to the tournament data. These updates reflect immediately on the /show/ID page.
